javacsw.services.loc

Class JLocationService

  • java.lang.Object
    • javacsw.services.loc.JLocationService

  • public class JLocationService
extends java.lang.Object
    Java API for the Location Service The Location Service is based on Multicast DNS (AppleTalk, Bonjour) and can be used to register and lookup akka and http based services in the local network. Every application using the location service should call the initInterface() method once at startup, before creating any actors. Note: On a mac, you can use the command line tool dns-sd to browse the registered services. On Linux use avahi-browse.

    • Method Detail

      • initInterface

        public static void initInterface()
        Sets the "akka.remote.artery.canonical.hostname" and net.mdns.interface system properties, if not already set on the command line (with -D), so that any services or akka actors created will use and publish the correct IP address. This method should be called before creating any actors or web services that depend on the location service.

        Note that calling this method overrides any setting for akka.remote.artery.canonical.hostname in the akka config file. Since the application config is immutable and cached once it is loaded, I can't think of a way to take the config setting into account here. This should not be a problem, since we don't want to hard code host names anyway.

      • register

        public static java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<LocationService.RegistrationResult> register(LocationService.Registration reg,
                                                                                                  akka.actor.ActorSystem system)
        Registers a component connection with the location sevice. The component will automatically be unregistered when the vm exists or when unregister() is called on the result of this method.
        Parameters:
        reg - component registration information
        system - akka system
        Returns:
        a future result that completes when the registration has completed and can be used to unregister later

      • registerAkkaConnection

        public static java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<LocationService.RegistrationResult> registerAkkaConnection(ComponentId componentId,
                                                                                                                akka.actor.ActorRef actorRef,
                                                                                                                java.lang.String prefix,
                                                                                                                akka.actor.ActorSystem system)
        Registers the given service for the local host and the given port (The full name of the local host will be used)
        Parameters:
        componentId - describes the component or service
        actorRef - the actor reference for the actor being registered
        prefix - indicates the part of a command service config that this service is interested in
        system - the actor system (needed to manage the future)
        Returns:
        a future object that can be used to close the connection and unregister the service

      • registerHttpConnection

        public static java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<LocationService.RegistrationResult> registerHttpConnection(ComponentId componentId,
                                                                                                                int port,
                                                                                                                java.lang.String path,
                                                                                                                akka.actor.ActorSystem system)
        Registers the given service for the local host and the given port (The full name of the local host will be used)
        Parameters:
        componentId - describes the component or service
        port - the port the service is running on
        path - the path part of the URI (default: empty)
        system - the actor system (needed to manage the future)
        Returns:
        a future object that can be used to close the connection and unregister the service

      • unregisterConnection

        public static void unregisterConnection(Connection connection)
        Unregisters the connection from the location service (Note: it can take some time before the service is removed from the list: see comments in registry.unregisterService())
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to unregister

      • resolve

        public static java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<LocationTrackerWorker.LocationsReady> resolve(java.util.Set<Connection> connections,
                                                                                                   akka.actor.ActorSystem system,
                                                                                                   akka.util.Timeout timeout)
        Convenience method that gets the location service information for a given set of services.
        Parameters:
        connections - set of requested connections
        system - the caller's actor system
        timeout - amount of time to wait before timing out
        Returns:
        a future object describing the services found
